dlgPart.npc_text:
You follow Levir down into an old passageway under the city, leading into a network of even older catacombs. Levir navigates them with the confidence of someone who has made the trip many times before. It takes you a quarter of an hour to arrive to Levir's destination.
You see a large sarcophagus, standing in the middle of a large chamber lit by torches. The chamber itself is plain and doesn’t seem to have a clearly discernible purpose. Most likely the sarcophagus was brought here for safe-keeping and then forgotten. The sarcophagus itself is a misshapen rectangular container, made of grey metal, with strange cylindrical extensions sticking out at odd angles.
“It's ready,” says a young woman standing in front of the sarcophagus.

dlgAnsw.text: Continue.

dlgPart.npc_text:
“Are you sure?” asks Levir, his voice strangely anxious.
“I checked everything several times,” replies the woman. “I followed my father’s notes to the letter.”
“Are you certain that we can’t test it?” asks Levir. “I’ve waited a long time for this moment, but I’ve never thought that I’d have to trust this machine blindly. What if...” He doesn’t continue.
“You saw the research,” says the woman without any empathy. “A jar contains a single dose and we only have one. I wouldn’t be surprised, if it’s all that’s left.”

dlgAnsw.text: Continue.

dlgPart.npc_text:
“But you’re certain that it will cure me?” says Levir, looking straight at her as if trying to see any signs of uncertainty in her eyes.
“Yes,” says the woman without any hesitation. “The machine’s curative properties are well documented. It works on a level unseen to the human eye and thus well beyond the capabilities of our best healers. Whatever it is that causes you to cough blood will be removed, the damage done to your organs healed.”
“Alright,” says Levir calmly. “Let’s do it. <charname>, make sure that everything goes smoothly. My life is in your hands now.” The woman smirks.

dlgAnsw.text: Continue.

dlgPart.npc_text: The woman presses a button and the machine’s hatch slowly opens. Levir takes off his armor and gets inside. As the hatch goes down, something inside the machine whirs to life and the woman presses another button.

dlgAnsw.text: “Who are you?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “My name is Iola. I’m a loremaster.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Aren’t you too young to be a loremaster?”
“What do you know about this machine?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Let’s just say it runs in the family.”

dlgAnsw.text: “What do you know about this machine?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“It’s a healing machine from the old days. Levir found it a long time ago and figured that it was very valuable since someone went to such lengths to keep it safe. My father worked for the guild, so Levir asked him to figure out what it does.
“My father spent a long time down here, with this machine. It was all he talked about and it was all I’ve heard about growing up. Some parts were missing, but he managed to recover them. After all, there is nothing the guild can’t get if they know where to get it.”

dlgAnsw.text: “A healing machine? Someone would go through all that trouble for a healing machine?”
“You mentioned something about a jar?”
“Are you sure that healing is all it does?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “It contains a liquid that was considered to be sacred and was worth a fortune after the fall. This liquid is injected into one’s body and works its miracles there. My father said that it is able to carry the energy of electrons into the depths of the body and bombard the nuclei of the cells, forcing them to repair and reject damage.”

dlgAnsw.text: “A healing machine? Someone would go through all that trouble for a healing machine?”
“Are you sure that healing is all it does?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Not every wound can be cleaned and stitched,” says Iola with contempt for your ignorance. “The old stories speak of weapons that cut deeper than flesh and bone. A healer who can’t see the damage can’t help you. This machine can.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Is that what happened to Levir?”
“You mentioned something about a jar?”
“Are you sure that healing is all it does?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “He has the coughing sickness. He tried every healer, but nothing helped. This machine is his only chance.”

dlgAnsw.text: “You mentioned something about a jar?”
“Are you sure that healing is all it does?”

dlgPart.npc_text: "It's all it does now," says Iola, putting an end to idle speculations. "Are you done questioning me?"

dlgAnsw.text: “I was just curious.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Now, can you keep quiet for a moment? I'm about to inject him and I need to concentrate.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Wait, something's wrong. Can you open the hatch again?”
Do what Levir asked you and let her finish the process.

dlgPart.npc_text: “He seems fine,” says Iola but opens the hatch nonetheless. Levir seems to be in deep sleep, his chest barely rising.

dlgAnsw.text: Kill him and use the machine yourself.
Do what Levir asked you and let her finish the process.

dlgPart.npc_text: Iola nods and starts pressing buttons, consulting her notes every now and then. After two hours the machine goes silent. Iola raises the hatch and checks Levir's vitals. “He's weak but alive. Help me get him out.”

dlgAnsw.text: Get Levir out and wait until he wakes up.

dlgPart.npc_text:
“What happened?” asks Levir weakly, getting up. “Why am I out?”
“It's done,” says Iola. “You were there for more than two hours. How is your chest? Any difference?”
“Too early to say,” says Levir after a pause. “I feel exhausted yet somehow ... better. Could be wishful thinking though.”

dlgAnsw.text: Continue.

dlgPart.npc_text:
“Thank you, <charname>,” says Levir. “I knew I could count on you. After you sort out that business in Ganezzar, come back and we'll talk about your future.
“I have plans for this city. I've lived under the shadow of my illness for too long. Now that I'm free of it, I don't want to waste what's left of my life lording over the Slums while others rule all.”

dlgAnsw.text: "Any idea what this thing might be? Gaelius had it on him." Show him the reliquary.
Leave the catacombs.

dlgPart.npc_text:
You flick your wrist, conjuring a blade, and stab Levir in the heart before anyone can react.
“What the fuck, <charname>?” says one of Levir guards, unslinging his axe.

dlgAnsw.text: Fight.

dlgPart.npc_text: FIGHT 2
END - Maadoran

"It's not a gemstone," says Levir after examining the reliquary, "so whatever value it has... Iola, I think it's definitely up your alley. Take a look."
"It's a key to Zamedi," Iola says with certainty. "There were several studies on the nature of the key, but their results were inconclusive at best."

dlgAnsw.text: "Zamedi?"

dlgPart.npc_text: "A town that was destroyed during the war. There is nothing left of it except for the tower. Let me mark it on your map, if you want to take a look."

dlgAnsw.text: "Thanks." Leave the catacombs.
